basic.floral_language:
Echeveria setosa
Floriography: cute tenacious, unique
Similar to Echeveria pulvinata, but has thicker leavers and longer leaf hairs, oval leaves with red tips, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, leaf edges turn red brown, suitable to plant alone or in combinations with other succulents, high ornamental value.
Likes sunshine, tolerates to half shade, has a short dormant period in summer, shade properly in a cool environment. Flowers are orange.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color black green, when sunny leaf tips turning to red brown

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
